content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame, col_name="dt")
    new_col = Int64[]
    for row in eachrow(df)
        dt_val = parse(DateTime, row[col_name]))
        ym_int = year(dt_val) * 100 + month(dt_val)
        push!(new_col, ym_int)
    end
    df[!, Symbol("ym")]] = new_col
    df
end
```

This function `add_yearmonth` takes a DataFrame `df` with a column `dt` representing DateTimes. It creates a new column `ym` by parsing the DateTime values from `dt`, extracting the year and month, and concatenating them as an integer in the format "yyyymm".

The modified DataFrame with the new column is returned.
